content: Sometimes, especially if there is an antivirus or firewall intercepting it, an update causes Thunderbird to lose pointer to profile, so it starts a fresh one. That is, your data may still be there, but in an older profile. Profiles are stored in c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles folder. One way to review that (other than with windows file explorer), is to click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles.' The next pane should show available profiles. I don't know if you can just select and go with another profile, or whether you need to extract data, but look first and see what's there.
creator: davidsk

content: Check your SMTP server settings. You probably do not have it set to authenticate with your email provider. You can access that pane by clicking 'account settings', scroll down left side past account name(s) to 'Outgoing Servers (SMTP) and click the account's server.
creator: davidsk

content: First, I've never seen this before, so I'll offer a guess on the situation. I am assuming you created a zip file with the tools>export feature? If so, then a possibility might be to unzip the folder to a space on your drive, and then try using the tools>import>import from anotherthunderbirdinstallation. If you made the backup in any other way, ignore this suggestion and provide information on how you did the backup.
creator: davidsk

content:
The process I did is as follows:

- Backup through Thunderbird (which automatically created a ZIP file)| - Then after migrating from one server to another, I first logged in and of course the email was empty - Then, after logging in, I unzipped the file that Thunderbird created for me (backup) and copied all the files to Thunderbird profiles and the default profile (name it profile.default). - After importing, everything is displayed from the old one, but it immediately asks me to enter the password from that email, after that, it pulls everything back from the new one without restore backup.


I tried to backup the whole ZIP file, but then it doesn't show anything
creator: Smile

content: When I make a backup or restore backup, it shows me everything that was on that backup, but when I want to open other folders, it gives me the error I wrote above and then gives me a window to enter the password from that email. After entering the password, it deletes everything that it pulled through the backup and only leaves the values ​​that are in the email account before the backup.

content:
È il valore del server. Se, come immagino, stai usando IMAP puoi utilizzare l'opzione "Elimina i messaggi più vecchi di" scegliendo un opportuno valore in giorni -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco

Però è più prudente procedere cancellando manualmente i messaggi più vecchi.

Attenzione perché con entrambi i metodi la posta cancellata in non è recuperabile! Per questo ti consiglio di crearne una copia sul tuo PC: devi copiare i messaggi in una sottocartella di Cartelle locali.

In alternativa puoi anche verificare presso il tuo fornitore se mette a disposizine opzioni per aumentare lo spazio sul server.
creator: @next

content:
Okay, this may sound strange, but here is the real way to set fonts on Thunderbird. And I attached examples of my own setting of Calibri 14 as my default. Here goes: 

- in Tools>settings>general, set your default font.  - then click the advanced button. Notice the drop-down menu at top. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - this is IMPORTANT:  - select 'latin from that menu, set your desired font and font size settings, click OK,  - select 'otherwritingsystems' from the drop-down menu and set the IDENTICAL settings to what you did for Latin, and then click OK. In attached screenshots you will see my latin and otherwritingsystem match.  Notice I also set monospace font. - and, if you have account set to compose HTML, then set that in tools>settings>composition to variable-width and medium font. (You would only change the HTML font setting if your intent is for recipient to receive your preferred font - not my personal recommendation.) - Set Sending Format to 'automatic'

With these settings, your compose window and your sent folders will match. And if you don't write HTML (e.g., bold, italic, color), none will be sent . If you do these settings once, your font will always be consistent. This does not protect you from someone sending you a message in some god-awful font with 30 pt size, but this does provide consistency.
creator: davidsk

content: Generally, the line-through happens when an account is set to immediately delete. If you set to move to Trash, I think the message will be moved immediately to trash and not appear with line through it.
creator: davidsk
